data.title: Two pandas to arrive in Thailand from China by 2027
data.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MNRE) is expected to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) next year on the transfer of two pandas from China, says permanent secretary Jatuporn Buruspat.

data.title: Thai govt officials to drive Formula 1 race talks forward
data.description: The government has vowed to bring a  Formula 1  (F1) racing event to Thailand to stimulate economic growth.

data.title: Thai parks dept submits controversial forest bills to cabinet
data.description: The Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP) will submit two draft laws to the cabinet next week, despite opposition from the People

data.title: Peru envoy hails PM's trip as chance to boost bilateral, Apec ties
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra

data.title: Govt under pressure over maritime MoU
data.description: The controversial 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  to jointly develop parts of an  overlapping claim area  (OCA) and set a maritime boundary continues to cast a shadow over Thailand.

data.title: Thai deputy PM makes case for Cambodia deal
data.description: TRAT - The government on Saturday reiterated that a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  is a mechanism to protect Thailand’s best interests, while insisting Thailand has sole  sovereignty  over  Koh Kut  in this eastern province.

data.title: Investigators tracking lawyer Sittra’s money trail
data.description: The Anti-Money Laundering Office (Amlo) is in talks with police investigators about tracking the money trail and assets of the high-profile lawyer  Sittra Biabungkerd  and his wife, who are facing charges of  fraud  and  money laundering .

data.title: Airport on alert for Loy Krathong risk
data.description: The public has been urged to refrain from flying lanterns or balloons, setting off  fireworks  or using lasers near and around  Suvarnabhumi Airport  during the  Loy Krathong  festival this coming Friday.

data.title: Two pandas to arrive from China by 2027
data.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment expects to sign an agreement next year on the transfer of two  pandas  from China, according to permanent secretary Jatuporn Buruspat.

data.title: Rifle used in Narathiwat murder linked to 24 cases
data.description: A military rifle used to kill the mayor of a tambon in Narathiwat has been traced to more than 20 different criminal cases throughout the southern region of Thailand.

data.title: Two Thai trade representatives appointed
data.description: The government has appointed Umesh Pandey and Werapong Prapha as Thai Trade Representatives.

data.title: Myanmar beauticians held for working illegally on Samui
data.description: Five Myanmar nationals were arrested on Koh Samui in Surat Thani province on Friday for working illegally as beauticians.

data.title: British bikers nabbed for disturbance in Phuket
data.description: Nine British nationals riding around  Phuket  in the early hours have been apprehended for disturbing the public peace after police received numerous complaints from residents and tourists.

data.title: Pathum Thani official stabbed to death
data.description: A senior local administrator was found dead with multiple stab wounds to her neck at her house in Khlong Luang district of Pathum Thani on Friday night.

data.title: British bikers nabbed for public disturbance in Phuket
data.description: Nine British nationals riding around  Phuket  in the early hours have been apprehended for disturbing the public peace after police received numerous complaints from residents and tourists.

data.title: Cambodia talks to restart soon
data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: National Health Security Office to investigate clinics that deny patient referrals
data.description: The National Health Security Office (NHSO) will probe clinics that fail to refer universal healthcare patients to hospitals, saying such conduct could result in legal action and punishment.

data.title: National Human Rights Commission endorses citizenship for minorities, migrants
data.description: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) welcomed the government

data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: More floods hit Mae Sai  as market bears brunt
data.description: CHIANG RAI: Locals of Mae Sai district have had to endure a fresh round of damage after more floods struck less than a month after recovering from rainy season inundation.

data.title: No change, no charter
data.description: The referendum is, without a doubt, intertwined with the fate of the constitutional amendment.

data.title: 'Live Airport' project offers cultural flair for travellers
data.description: A "Live Airport" concept has been piloted at Phitsanulok and Nan airports to promote both provinces
